title: Green Rockets Tokatsu
text:
Green Rockets Tokatsu (formerly NEC Green Rockets) is a Japanese <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team in the <a href="Japan%20Rugby%20League%20One">Japan Rugby League One</a>. The team's captain is <a href="http%3A//www.necsports.net/rugby/member/ply_asano.php">Ryota Asano</a>. The previous captain was <a href="Takuro%20Miuchi">Takuro Miuchi</a>, who was also the captain of the <a href="Japan%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Japan national rugby union team</a>. Before the semi-professional <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a> was created, the team was just known as "NEC". The amateur club was founded in 1985 in the <a href="Kant%C5%8D%20region">Kantō region</a>.
NEC Green Rockets won the <a href="42nd%20All%20Japan%20Rugby%20Football%20Championship">All-Japan Championship</a> final for the second time on 27 February 2005, beating <a href="Toyota%20Verblitz">Toyota Verblitz</a> 17-13. They drew 6-6 with <a href="Toshiba%20Brave%20Lupus">Toshiba Brave Lupus</a> in the 43rd Japan Championship final on 26 February 2006 after an effective defensive effort and the <a href="Sin%20bin%23Rugby%20league%20and%20rugby%20union">sin-binning</a> of <a href="Glen%20Marsh">Glen Marsh</a> in the last ten minutes of the game.
The team rebranded as Green Rockets Tokatsu ahead of the rebranding of the Top League to the <a href="Japan%20Rugby%20League%20One">Japan Rugby League One</a> in 2022.
